hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a neutral regime (55-70% confidence) with 20-day realized volatility dropping below 40% and 7-day volatility below 25%, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std) on >1.5x average volume signals an imminent transition to BULL regime, with 3-day forward returns exceeding +5%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral regimes often precedes directional moves. Low volatility indicates equilibrium that breaks with institutional accumulation. Volume confirmation reduces false breakouts. Regulatory clarity (MiCA) may provide fundamental catalyst for sustained moves.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes > 20-day BB upper band (2 std)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3-day forward return > +5% OR regime transitions to BULL (>75% confidence)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain >2 days OR forward returns < +2% on average across 20+ signals
